common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM and CPU usage by PiecesOS, sometimes exceeding 2GB RAM and causing system slowdowns. This issue may be related to internet connectivity or the Live Context feature. Short-term solutions include restarting PiecesOS or unloading ML models. The Pieces team is actively working on performance optimization.

related_issues.title: Neural Code Search returns no results
related_issues.text:
Neural Code Search returns no results
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have four materials entered since a few days ago and NCS type search never returns anything.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cea82b95-b382-45f3-8777-227d3abd2269)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/175e6117-9ef6-49c0-94f2-26812b788080)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** 
- User (@hovek) reported issues with the search functionality in Pieces.
- Existing search options are confusing and don't meet user expectations.

**Key Points:**
- NCS search: Focuses on semantic meaning of code, good for finding similar code or topics.
- FTS search: Traditional character-for-character search, searches within snippet content only.
- Blended search: Combines content and metadata search with fuzzy matching.

**Solutions:**
- Pieces team acknowledged the need for search improvements and planned an upgrade for the end of the quarter.
- Mark-at-pieces provided guidance on using existing search methods effectively.

**Outcome:**
- Search upgrade is planned for the future.
- User received clarification on current search functionalities.

**Current Status:**
- The issue remains open, awaiting the planned search upgrade. 
- Users are encouraged to use the available search methods and provide feedback for further improvement.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary:

**Key Points:**

- User reported two issues: context omission and line number wrapping.
- Issues were identified in Pieces using Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o.
- Support team members @mark-at-pieces and @sam-at-pieces collaborated to investigate and resolve the issues.

**Problems Identified:**

1. **Context Issue:** Pieces incorrectly asked for the Python file in the context despite having access to it.
2. **Line Number Wrapping:** Line numbers in the response were wrapping incorrectly.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- @mark-at-pieces and @sam-at-pieces investigated the context issue and identified a fix.
- @mark-at-pieces confirmed the fix for the context issue and mentioned it would be included in the upcoming 11.0.4 release.
- No information on the resolution for the line number wrapping issue was provided.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The context issue is resolved and will be released with Pieces 11.0.4.
- The status of the line number wrapping issue is unclear.

**Additional Notes:**

- The conversation highlights the responsiveness and collaboration of the Pieces support team.
- The user expressed appreciation for the team's efforts. 
- No further updates were provided regarding the line number wrapping issue.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: High RAM and CPU Usage in PiecesOS 

**Key Points Raised:**

- Several users reported high RAM and CPU usage by PiecesOS, exceeding 2GB of RAM and causing performance issues. 
- The high RAM usage was observed even when no models were installed or running, leading to suspicion of potential mining activities.
- Users also reported high CPU usage causing system slowdowns and spikes of up to 50%.

**Problems Identified:**

- High memory consumption and resource demands of PiecesOS, particularly when utilizing the Live Context feature powered by the Workstream Pattern Engine.
- Lack of clarity regarding the specific cause of high resource usage, leading to speculation and concerns.
- Potential impact on user experience and system performance due to high resource demands.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- **Memory Optimization feature**: Clicking on the Pieces "P" icon allows users to unload in-use ML models, potentially freeing up some RAM.
- **Work on performance improvements**: The Pieces team is actively working on optimizing PiecesOS to reduce its memory footprint and overall resource usage. 
- **Offer of individual troubleshooting**: The Pieces team has provided a link to schedule a call for users experiencing excessive resource consumption beyond the expected 2GB.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue of high resource usage remains unresolved for many users, causing frustration and impacting their workflow. 
- While Pieces acknowledges the problem and is working on improvements, there's no definitive timeline for a fix.
- Some users have opted to deactivate PiecesOS due to its high resource demands.

**Additional Observations:**

- The conversation spans a significant timeframe, indicating that the problem has persisted for several months, despite ongoing efforts to address it. 
- User frustration is evident in the comments, highlighting the need for a solution to ensure smooth and efficient operation of PiecesOS.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot experiencing errors and unresponsiveness
common_issues.description: Users are reporting various issues with Pieces Copilot, including error messages, unresponsiveness, and incorrect output. These issues appear to be related to both the desktop application and integrations. Proposed solutions include upgrading to the latest Pieces OS version, removing OpenAI API keys, and using alternative language models like GPT4o.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* Some users were experiencing issues with the "Claude" and "Gemini" language models.
* Removing the OpenAI API key resolved the issue for some users.
* Switching to the "GPT4o" model was suggested as a workaround.

**Problems Identified:**

* Claude and Gemini models were experiencing issues.
* Some users' OpenAI API keys were causing failures.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Remove the OpenAI API key.
* Switch to the GPT4o model.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Users are advised to keep their OpenAI API key out of the product until further investigation.
* GPT4o is recommended as a stable alternative.

**Additional Notes:**

* Please update to Pieces version 11.0.3 for optimal performance.
* Ensure you are signed in to Pieces for a higher rate limit.
* If issues persist, contact support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## Pieces Copilot Response Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

- Gittydia reported an issue with Pieces Copilot, where they received an error message stating "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with the processing. Please..."
- Pieces Support Bot automatically triaged the issue and offered relevant resources.
- Mark, a Pieces team member, confirmed the issue and informed Gittydia that a fix is included in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4, expected by Thursday.

**Problems Identified:**

- Pieces Copilot was generating an error message instead of providing a proper response.
- This likely impacted Gittydia's workflow and productivity.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- A fix for the issue is included in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The fix is expected to be available by Thursday. 
- Gittydia is asked to report back on Friday if the issue persists.

**Additional Notes:**

- The issue appears similar to other reported cases with Copilot responses.
- Pieces provides helpful resources for troubleshooting and support.

common_issues.title: VS Code Extension Connection Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting the VS Code extension to Pieces OS, particularly in remote environments like WSL2 and DevContainers.  Common issues include rendering problems with Pieces Copilot and general connection failures. Solutions involve ensuring proper network configuration, using the latest extension version, and potentially adjusting Pieces OS settings to listen on all interfaces.

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* Network issues may be the root problem, potentially within WSL2.
* Systemd flag in WSL config and dns-tunnel in WSL2 are suggested solutions.
* Enabling `systemd=true` in `/etc/wsl.conf` and mirroring the networking mode were attempted.

**Problems Identified:**

* Code Copilot cannot render properly, though healthcheck API returns "ok."
* Unsure if issue is WSL2 or Snap installation related.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Enabling `dns-tunnel` in WSL2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue remains unresolved.
* Further investigation and updates needed.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## GitHub Issue Summary: Connecting to Pieces OS from DevContainer **Key points raised:** * User is unable to connect to Pieces OS from their DevContainer, even with no project open. * This issue seems related to remote instances and custom URLs. **Problems identified:** * Newer Pieces OS versions listen on the loopback interface by default, causing connection issues from DevContainers. * Host.docker.internal resolution does not work with Webview tool windows. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * A patch was released to allow listening on all interfaces. * A workaround involving DNS entries was suggested. * Pieces for VSCode extension version 2.0.1 was released to automatically detect Pieces OS without a custom URL. * Version 2.0.2 of the extension further resolved the issue. **Current status/outcome:** * The issue is resolved with the latest version of the extension. **Additional notes:** * The user will be contacted for a video call to ensure the issue is fully resolved.

Pieces OS does not connect to Jetbrains plugin

Pieces OS, JetBrains

10.1.9

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Jetbrains plugin not connecting to pieces OS even though it is online 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2a336b09-c8ed-4d3a-88c3-f9f582f95f4d)

## GitHub Issue Summary:

**Key points raised:**

- User (@Farhan-Nahiyan) experiencing an issue with Pieces OS
- Logs requested for troubleshooting
- Live debug call suggested

**Problems identified:**

- The specific issue is not explicitly mentioned in the conversation.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- @caleb-at-pieces suggested two potential solutions:
    1. Analyzing logs from Documents\com.pieces.os\production\Support\logs
    2. Debugging live on a call (scheduling link provided)
- Additionally, a build of Pieces OS with a potential fix was created and shared for testing.
- User was advised to uninstall the current version, install the new build, and test if the issue is resolved.
- Reinstallation of the production version after testing was recommended.

**Current status/outcome:**

- Unknown. It's unclear whether the user tested the new build or participated in the live debug session.

**Note:**

The conversation lacks details about the exact issue and its resolution. More information is required to provide a definitive summary.

common_issues.title: Desktop application bugs reported by users

These bugs were acknowledged by the Pieces team, and solutions such as patches and updates were proposed. Users were advised to update to the latest version or wait for upcoming releases for fixes.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS fails to launch or connect
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS desktop app failing to launch, showing a blank window, or getting stuck on "Connecting." Issues also appear with browser extensions and JetBrains plugin failing to connect. Proposed solutions involve checking for updates, examining log files, and live debugging sessions with support.

related_issues.title: Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
related_issues.text:
Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

version: 8.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Issue:**
I am encountering difficulties with installing and launching the Pieces Windows desktop version. After a successful installation, the software fails to open properly. Despite confirming its presence in the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

- Download and install the Pieces Windows desktop version.
- Attempt to launch the software.
- Observe that the program does not open on the screen.
- Check the task manager to confirm the software is running in the background.

**Expected Behavior:**
Upon installation, the Pieces Windows desktop version should launch and display its interface on the screen, allowing users to interact with it

**Actual Behavior:**
After installation, the software does not open as expected. Despite running in the background according to the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**System Information:**

- Windows version: 22H2 (OS Build 19045)

**Additional Notes:**
I have attempted to troubleshoot this issue without success. Any assistance or insights into resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues launching Pieces OS on both Windows 11 and MacOS.
* Users report the Pieces desktop app opening but showing an empty blue window, and the "Connect Pieces App" popup appearing while using the Chrome extension.
* An error message appears in Brave browser stating "Failed to connect to Pieces OS".
* Users have confirmed their installations are up-to-date and app logs have been shared.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS may not be launching properly on Windows and Mac.
* The Chrome extension may not be able to connect to Pieces OS.
* There may be compatibility issues with specific browsers like Brave.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Request for app log files to investigate the issue further.
* Potential relation to other open issues.
* Verification of updates.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is still ongoing and affecting multiple users.
* More information is required to diagnose the root cause.
* No definitive solution has been implemented yet.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users have provided detailed descriptions of the problem, including device and software versions.
* This information will be crucial in resolving the issue.

recommendations: **Address Pieces OS Performance:** Investigate and optimize the high RAM and CPU usage reported by users, particularly related to internet connectivity and the Live Context feature.
**Improve Pieces Copilot Stability:** Troubleshoot and resolve the errors, unresponsiveness, and incorrect output experienced with Pieces Copilot across different platforms and integrations.

**Enhance VS Code Extension Connectivity:** Provide clearer instructions and solutions for connection issues between the VS Code extension and Pieces OS, especially in remote environments like WSL2 and DevContainers.
**Prioritize Desktop Application Bug Fixes:** Address the reported bugs in the desktop application, such as issues with saving conversation titles, snippet welcome messages, and Copilot responses.

**Investigate Pieces OS Launch Failures:** Identify the root cause and provide solutions for Pieces OS failing to launch or connect, including blank windows and "Connecting" issues across different platforms and plugins.
**Proactive Communication:** Keep users informed about the status of known issues, planned fixes, and estimated resolution timelines through release notes, blog posts, or in-app notifications.
**Expand Troubleshooting Resources:** Enhance documentation and support resources with detailed troubleshooting steps, FAQs, and known workarounds for common issues.

**Gather User Feedback:** Implement a system for collecting user feedback on specific features, pain points, and suggestions for improvement. This can be done through surveys, in-app feedback forms, or community forums.
**Monitor Error Logs:** Implement robust error logging and monitoring to proactively identify and address emerging issues before they impact a large number of users.
**Performance Testing:** Conduct thorough performance testing before releasing new versions or features to ensure optimal resource usage and minimize performance issues for users.
